intro: Adelodypsis, commonly known as the stonecress, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Brassicaceae. These plants are characterized by their compact growth habit and fleshy, often succulent leaves. Adelodypsis species are typically found in arid or semi-arid regions, where they have adapted to withstand drought conditions. They produce small, white or yellow flowers that are arranged in racemes, and their seeds are enclosed in siliques. The genus includes several species, some of which are cultivated for their ornamental value and hardiness.
